22enum class UVHandleType: std::underlying_type_t<uv_handle_type> {
23 UNKNOWN = UV_UNKNOWN_HANDLE,
24 ASYNC = UV_ASYNC,
25 CHECK = UV_CHECK,
26 FS_EVENT = UV_FS_EVENT,
27 FS_POLL = UV_FS_POLL,
28 HANDLE = UV_HANDLE,
29 IDLE = UV_IDLE,
30 PIPE = UV_NAMED_PIPE,
31 POLL = UV_POLL,
32 PREPARE = UV_PREPARE,
33 PROCESS = UV_PROCESS,
34 STREAM = UV_STREAM,
35 TCP = UV_TCP,
36 TIMER = UV_TIMER,
37 TTY = UV_TTY,
38 UDP = UV_UDP,
39 SIGNAL = UV_SIGNAL,
40 FILE = UV_FILE
41};
42
43
44template<typename T>
45struct UVTypeWrapper {
46 using Type = T;
47
48 constexpr UVTypeWrapper(): value{} {}
49 constexpr UVTypeWrapper(Type val): value{val} {}
50
51 constexpr operator Type() const noexcept { return value; }
52
53 bool operator==(UVTypeWrapper other) const noexcept {
54 return value == other.value;
55 }
56
57private:
58 const Type value;
59};
60
61
62template<typename T>
63bool operator==(UVTypeWrapper<T> lhs, UVTypeWrapper<T> rhs) {
64 return !(lhs == rhs);
65}
66
67
68}
69
70
71/**
72 * @brief Utility class to handle flags.
73 *
74 * This class can be used to handle flags of a same enumeration type.<br/>
75 * It is meant to be used as an argument for functions and member methods and
76 * as part of events.<br/>
77 * `Flags<E>` objects can be easily _or-ed_ and _and-ed_ with other instances of
78 * the same type or with instances of the type `E` (that is, the actual flag
79 * type), thus converted to the underlying type when needed.
80 */
81template<typename E>
82class Flags final {
83 using InnerType = std::underlying_type_t<E>;
84
85 constexpr InnerType toInnerType(E flag) const noexcept { return static_cast<InnerType>(flag); }
86
87public:
88 using Type = InnerType;
89
90 /**
91 * @brief Utility factory method to pack a set of values all at once.
92 * @return A valid instance of Flags instantiated from values `V`.
93 */
94 template<E... V>
95 static constexpr Flags<E> from() {
96 return (Flags<E>{} | ... | V);
97 }
98
99 /**
100 * @brief Constructs a Flags object from a value of the enum `E`.
101 * @param flag A value of the enum `E`.
102 */
103 constexpr Flags(E flag) noexcept: flags{toInnerType(flag)} {}
104
105 /**
106 * @brief Constructs a Flags object from an instance of the underlying type
107 * of the enum `E`.
108 * @param f An instance of the underlying type of the enum `E`.
109 */
110 constexpr Flags(Type f): flags{f} {}
111
112 /**
113 * @brief Constructs an uninitialized Flags object.
114 */
115 constexpr Flags(): flags{} {}
116
117 constexpr Flags(const Flags &f) noexcept: flags{f.flags} { }
118 constexpr Flags(Flags &&f) noexcept: flags{std::move(f.flags)} { }
119
120 ~Flags() noexcept { static_assert(std::is_enum_v<E>); }
121
122 constexpr Flags & operator=(const Flags &f) noexcept {
123 flags = f.flags;
124 return *this;
125 }
126
127 constexpr Flags & operator=(Flags &&f) noexcept {
128 flags = std::move(f.flags);
129 return *this;
130 }
131
132 /**
133 * @brief Or operator.
134 * @param f A valid instance of Flags.
135 * @return This instance _or-ed_ with `f`.
136 */
137 constexpr Flags operator|(const Flags &f) const noexcept { return Flags{flags | f.flags}; }
138
139 /**
140 * @brief Or operator.
141 * @param flag A value of the enum `E`.
142 * @return This instance _or-ed_ with `flag`.
143 */
144 constexpr Flags operator|(E flag) const noexcept { return Flags{flags | toInnerType(flag)}; }
145
146 /**
147 * @brief And operator.
148 * @param f A valid instance of Flags.
149 * @return This instance _and-ed_ with `f`.
150 */
151 constexpr Flags operator&(const Flags &f) const noexcept { return Flags{flags & f.flags}; }
152
153 /**
154 * @brief And operator.
155 * @param flag A value of the enum `E`.
156 * @return This instance _and-ed_ with `flag`.
157 */
158 constexpr Flags operator&(E flag) const noexcept { return Flags{flags & toInnerType(flag)}; }
159
160 /**
161 * @brief Checks if this instance is initialized.
162 * @return False if it's uninitialized, true otherwise.
163 */
164 explicit constexpr operator bool() const noexcept { return !(flags == InnerType{}); }
165
166 /**
167 * @brief Casts the instance to the underlying type of `E`.
168 * @return An integral representation of the contained flags.
169 */
170 constexpr operator Type() const noexcept { return flags; }
171
172private:
173 InnerType flags;
174};
175
176
177/**
178 * @brief Windows size representation.
179 */
180struct WinSize {
181 int width; /*!< The _width_ of the given window. */
182 int height; /*!< The _height_ of the given window. */
183};

186using HandleType = details::UVHandleType; /*!< The type of a handle. */
187
188using HandleCategory = details::UVTypeWrapper<uv_handle_type>; /*!< Utility class that wraps an internal handle type. */
189using FileHandle = details::UVTypeWrapper<uv_file>; /*!< Utility class that wraps an internal file handle. */
190using OSSocketHandle = details::UVTypeWrapper<uv_os_sock_t>; /*!< Utility class that wraps an os socket handle. */
191using OSFileDescriptor = details::UVTypeWrapper<uv_os_fd_t>; /*!< Utility class that wraps an os file descriptor. */
192using PidType = details::UVTypeWrapper<uv_pid_t>; /*!< Utility class that wraps a cross platform representation of a pid. */
193
194constexpr FileHandle StdIN{0}; /*!< Placeholder for stdin descriptor. */
195constexpr FileHandle StdOUT{1}; /*!< Placeholder for stdout descriptor. */
196constexpr FileHandle StdERR{2}; /*!< Placeholder for stderr descriptor. */
197
198using TimeSpec = uv_timespec_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_timespec_t. */
199using Stat = uv_stat_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_stat_t. */
200using Statfs = uv_statfs_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_statfs_t. */
201using Uid = uv_uid_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_uid_t. */
202using Gid = uv_gid_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_gid_t. */
203
204using TimeVal = uv_timeval_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_timeval_t. */
205using TimeVal64 = uv_timeval64_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_timeval64_t. */
206using RUsage = uv_rusage_t; /*!< Library equivalent for uv_rusage_t. */

209/**
210 * @brief Utility class.
211 *
212 * This class can be used to query the subset of the password file entry for the
213 * current effective uid (not the real uid).
214 *
215 * \sa Utilities::passwd
216 */
217struct Passwd {
218 Passwd(std::shared_ptr<uv_passwd_t> pwd);
219
220 /**
221 * @brief Gets the username.
222 * @return The username of the current effective uid (not the real uid).
223 */
224 std::string username() const noexcept;
225
226 /**
227 * @brief Gets the uid.
228 * @return The current effective uid (not the real uid).
229 */
230 decltype(uv_passwd_t::uid) uid() const noexcept;
231
232 /**
233 * @brief Gets the gid.
234 * @return The gid of the current effective uid (not the real uid).
235 */
236 decltype(uv_passwd_t::gid) gid() const noexcept;
237
238 /**
239 * @brief Gets the shell.
240 * @return The shell of the current effective uid (not the real uid).
241 */
242 std::string shell() const noexcept;
243
244 /**
245 * @brief Gets the homedir.
246 * @return The homedir of the current effective uid (not the real uid).
247 */
248 std::string homedir() const noexcept;
249
250 /**
251 * @brief Checks if the instance contains valid data.
252 * @return True if data are all valid, false otherwise.
253 */
254 operator bool() const noexcept;
255
256private:
257 std::shared_ptr<uv_passwd_t> passwd;
258};
259
260
261/**
262 * @brief Utility class.
263 *
264 * This class can be used to get name and information about the current kernel.
265 * The populated data includes the operating system name, release, version, and
266 * machine.
267 *
268 * \sa Utilities::uname
269 */
270struct UtsName {
271 UtsName(std::shared_ptr<uv_utsname_t> utsname);
272
273 /**
274 * @brief Gets the operating system name (like "Linux").
275 * @return The operating system name.
276 */
277 std::string sysname() const noexcept;
278
279 /**
280 * @brief Gets the operating system release (like "2.6.28").
281 * @return The operating system release.
282 */
283 std::string release() const noexcept;
284
285 /**
286 * @brief Gets the operating system version.
287 * @return The operating system version
288 */
289 std::string version() const noexcept;
290
291 /**
292 * @brief Gets the hardware identifier.
293 * @return The hardware identifier.
294 */
295 std::string machine() const noexcept;
296
297private:
298 std::shared_ptr<uv_utsname_t> utsname;
299};

302/**
303 * @brief The IPv4 tag.
304 *
305 * To be used as template parameter to switch between IPv4 and IPv6.
306 */
307struct IPv4 {};
308
309
310/**
311 * @brief The IPv6 tag.
312 *
313 * To be used as template parameter to switch between IPv4 and IPv6.
314 */
315struct IPv6 {};
316
317
318/**
319 * @brief Address representation.
320 */
321struct Addr {
322 std::string ip; /*!< Either an IPv4 or an IPv6. */
323 unsigned int port; /*!< A valid service identifier. */
324};
325
326
327/**
328 * \brief CPU information.
329 */
330struct CPUInfo {
331 using CPUTime = decltype(uv_cpu_info_t::cpu_times);
332
333 std::string model; /*!< The model of the CPU. */
334 int speed; /*!< The frequency of the CPU. */
335
336 /**
337 * @brief CPU times.
338 *
339 * It is built up of the following data members: `user`, `nice`, `sys`,
340 * `idle`, `irq`, all of them having type `uint64_t`.
341 */
342 CPUTime times;
343};
344
345
346/**
347 * \brief Interface address.
348 */
349struct InterfaceAddress {
350 std::string name; /*!< The name of the interface (as an example _eth0_). */
351 char physical[6]; /*!< The physical address. */
352 bool internal; /*!< True if it is an internal interface (as an example _loopback_), false otherwise. */
353 Addr address; /*!< The address of the given interface. */
354 Addr netmask; /*!< The netmask of the given interface. */
355};
356
357
358namespace details {
359
360
361static constexpr std::size_t DEFAULT_SIZE = 128;
362
363
364template<typename>
365struct IpTraits;
366
367
368template<>
369struct IpTraits<IPv4> {
370 using Type = sockaddr_in;
371 using AddrFuncType = int(*)(const char *, int, Type *);
372 using NameFuncType = int(*)(const Type *, char *, std::size_t);
373 static constexpr AddrFuncType addrFunc = &uv_ip4_addr;
374 static constexpr NameFuncType nameFunc = &uv_ip4_name;
375 static constexpr auto sinPort(const Type *addr) { return addr->sin_port; }
376};
377
378
379template<>
380struct IpTraits<IPv6> {
381 using Type = sockaddr_in6;
382 using AddrFuncType = int(*)(const char *, int, Type *);
383 using NameFuncType = int(*)(const Type *, char *, std::size_t);
384 static constexpr AddrFuncType addrFunc = &uv_ip6_addr;
385 static constexpr NameFuncType nameFunc = &uv_ip6_name;
386 static constexpr auto sinPort(const Type *addr) { return addr->sin6_port; }
387};
388
389
390template<typename I>
391Addr address(const typename details::IpTraits<I>::Type *aptr) noexcept {
392 Addr addr;
393 char name[DEFAULT_SIZE];
394
395 int err = details::IpTraits<I>::nameFunc(aptr, name, DEFAULT_SIZE);
396
397 if(0 == err) {
398 addr.port = ntohs(details::IpTraits<I>::sinPort(aptr));
399 addr.ip = std::string{name};
400 }
401
402 return addr;
403}
404
405
406template<typename I, typename F, typename H>
407Addr address(F &&f, const H *handle) noexcept {
408 sockaddr_storage ssto;
409 int len = sizeof(ssto);
410 Addr addr{};
411
412 int err = std::forward<F>(f)(handle, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr *>(&ssto), &len);
413
414 if(0 == err) {
415 typename IpTraits<I>::Type *aptr = reinterpret_cast<typename IpTraits<I>::Type *>(&ssto);
416 addr = address<I>(aptr);
417 }
418
419 return addr;
420}
421
422
423template<typename F, typename... Args>
424std::string tryRead(F &&f, Args&&... args) noexcept {
425 std::size_t size = DEFAULT_SIZE;
426 char buf[DEFAULT_SIZE];
427 std::string str{};
428 auto err = std::forward<F>(f)(args..., buf, &size);
429
430 if(UV_ENOBUFS == err) {
431 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data{new char[size]};
432 err = std::forward<F>(f)(args..., data.get(), &size);
433
434 if(0 == err) {
435 str = data.get();
436 }
437 } else if(0 == err) {
438 str.assign(buf, size);
439 }
440
441 return str;
442}
443
444
445}
446
447
448/**
449 * @brief Miscellaneous utilities.
450 *
451 * Miscellaneous functions that dont really belong to any other class.
452 */
453struct Utilities {
454 using MallocFuncType = void*(*)(size_t);
455 using ReallocFuncType = void*(*)(void*, size_t);
456 using CallocFuncType = void*(*)(size_t, size_t);
457 using FreeFuncType = void(*)(void*);
458
459 /**
460 * @brief OS dedicated utilities.
461 */
462 struct OS {
463 /**
464 * @brief Returns the current process id.
465 *
466 * See the official
467 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_os_getpid)
468 * for further details.
469 *
470 * @return The current process id.
471 */
472 static PidType pid() noexcept;
473
474 /**
475 * @brief Returns the parent process id.
476 *
477 * See the official
478 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_os_getppid)
479 * for further details.
480 *
481 * @return The parent process id.
482 */
483 static PidType parent() noexcept;
484
485 /**
486 * @brief Gets the current user's home directory.
487 *
488 * See the official
489 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_os_homedir)
490 * for further details.
491 *
492 * @return The current user's home directory, an empty string in case of
493 * errors.
494 */
495 static std::string homedir() noexcept;
496
497 /**
498 * @brief Gets the temp directory.
499 *
500 * See the official
501 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_os_tmpdir)
502 * for further details.
503 *
504 * @return The temp directory, an empty string in case of errors.
505 */
506 static std::string tmpdir() noexcept;
507
508 /**
509 * @brief Retrieves an environment variable.
510 * @param name The name of the variable to be retrieved.
511 * @return The value of the environment variable, an empty string in
512 * case of errors.
513 */
514 static std::string env(const std::string &name) noexcept;
515
516 /**
517 * @brief Creates, updates or deletes an environment variable.
518 * @param name The name of the variable to be updated.
519 * @param value The value to be used for the variable (an empty string
520 * to unset it).
521 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
522 */
523 static bool env(const std::string &name, const std::string &value) noexcept;
524
525 /**
526 * @brief Retrieves all environment variables and iterates them.
527 *
528 * Environment variables are passed one at a time to the callback in the
529 * form of `std::string_view`s.<br/>
530 * The signature of the function call operator must be such that it
531 * accepts two parameters, the name and the value of the i-th variable.
532 *
533 * @tparam Func Type of a function object to which to pass environment
534 * variables.
535 * @param func A function object to which to pass environment variables.
536 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
537 */
538 template<typename Func>
539 static std::enable_if_t<std::is_invocable_v<Func, std::string_view, std::string_view>, bool>
540 env(Func func) noexcept {
541 uv_env_item_t *items = nullptr;
542 int count{};
543
544 const bool ret = (uv_os_environ(&items, &count) == 0);
545
546 if(ret) {
547 for(int pos = 0; pos < count; ++pos) {
548 func(std::string_view{items[pos].name}, std::string_view{items[pos].value});
549 }
550
551 uv_os_free_environ(items, count);
552 }
553
554 return ret;
555 }
556
557 /**
558 * @brief Returns the hostname.
559 * @return The hostname, an empty string in case of errors.
560 */
561 static std::string hostname() noexcept;
562
563 /**
564 * @brief Gets name and information about the current kernel.
565 *
566 * This function can be used to get name and information about the
567 * current kernel. The populated data includes the operating system
568 * name, release, version, and machine.
569 *
570 * @return Name and information about the current kernel.
571 */
572 static UtsName uname() noexcept;
573
574 /**
575 * @brief Gets a subset of the password file entry.
576 *
577 * This function can be used to get the subset of the password file
578 * entry for the current effective uid (not the real uid).
579 *
580 * See the official
581 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_os_get_passwd)
582 * for further details.
583 *
584 * @return The accessible subset of the password file entry.
585 */
586 static Passwd passwd() noexcept;
587 };
588
589 /**
590 * @brief Retrieves the scheduling priority of a process.
591 *
592 * The returned value is between -20 (high priority) and 19 (low priority).
593 * A value that is out of range is returned in case of errors.
594 *
595 * @note
596 * On Windows, the result won't equal necessarily the exact value of the
597 * priority because of a mapping to a Windows priority class.
598 *
599 * @param pid A valid process id.
600 * @return The scheduling priority of the process.
601 */
602 static int osPriority(PidType pid);
603
604 /**
605 * @brief Sets the scheduling priority of a process.
606 *
607 * The returned value range is between -20 (high priority) and 19 (low
608 * priority).
609 *
610 * @note
611 * On Windows, the priority is mapped to a Windows priority class. When
612 * retrieving the process priority, the result won't equal necessarily the
613 * exact value of the priority.
614 *
615 * @param pid A valid process id.
616 * @param prio The scheduling priority to set to the process.
617 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
618 */
619 static bool osPriority(PidType pid, int prio);
620
621 /**
622 * @brief Gets the type of the handle given a category.
623 * @param category A properly initialized handle category.
624 * @return The actual type of the handle as defined by HandleType
625 */
626 static HandleType guessHandle(HandleCategory category) noexcept;
627
628 /**
629 * @brief Gets the type of the stream to be used with the given descriptor.
630 *
631 * Returns the type of stream that should be used with a given file
632 * descriptor.<br/>
633 * Usually this will be used during initialization to guess the type of the
634 * stdio streams.
635 *
636 * @param file A valid descriptor.
637 * @return One of the following types:
638 *
639 * * `HandleType::UNKNOWN`
640 * * `HandleType::PIPE`
641 * * `HandleType::TCP`
642 * * `HandleType::TTY`
643 * * `HandleType::UDP`
644 * * `HandleType::FILE`
645 */
646 static HandleType guessHandle(FileHandle file) noexcept;
647
648 /** @brief Gets information about the CPUs on the system.
649 *
650 * This function can be used to query the underlying system and get a set of
651 * descriptors of all the available CPUs.
652 *
653 * @return A set of descriptors of all the available CPUs.
654 */
655 static std::vector<CPUInfo> cpuInfo() noexcept;
656
657 /**
658 * @brief Gets a set of descriptors of all the available interfaces.
659 *
660 * This function can be used to query the underlying system and get a set of
661 * descriptors of all the available interfaces, either internal or not.
662 *
663 * @return A set of descriptors of all the available interfaces.
664 */
665 static std::vector<InterfaceAddress> interfaceAddresses() noexcept;
666
667 /**
668 * @brief IPv6-capable implementation of
669 * [if_indextoname](https://linux.die.net/man/3/if_indextoname).
670 *
671 * Mapping between network interface names and indexes.
672 *
673 * See the official
674 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_if_indextoname)
675 * for further details.
676 *
677 * @param index Network interface index.
678 * @return Network interface name.
679 */
680 static std::string indexToName(unsigned int index) noexcept;
681
682 /**
683 * @brief Retrieves a network interface identifier.
684 *
685 * See the official
686 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/misc.html#c.uv_if_indextoiid)
687 * for further details.
688 *
689 * @param index Network interface index.
690 * @return Network interface identifier.
691 */
692 static std::string indexToIid(unsigned int index) noexcept;
693
694 /**
695 * @brief Override the use of some standard librarys functions.
696 *
697 * Override the use of the standard librarys memory allocation
698 * functions.<br/>
699 * This method must be invoked before any other `uvw` function is called or
700 * after all resources have been freed and thus the underlying library
701 * doesnt reference any allocated memory chunk.
702 *
703 * If any of the function pointers is _null_, the invokation will fail.
704 *
705 * @note
706 * There is no protection against changing the allocator multiple times. If
707 * the user changes it they are responsible for making sure the allocator is
708 * changed while no memory was allocated with the previous allocator, or
709 * that they are compatible.
710 *
711 * @param mallocFunc Replacement function for _malloc_.
712 * @param reallocFunc Replacement function for _realloc_.
713 * @param callocFunc Replacement function for _calloc_.
714 * @param freeFunc Replacement function for _free_.
715 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
716 */
717 static bool replaceAllocator(MallocFuncType mallocFunc, ReallocFuncType reallocFunc, CallocFuncType callocFunc, FreeFuncType freeFunc) noexcept;
718
719 /**
720 * @brief Gets the load average.
721 * @return `[0,0,0]` on Windows (not available), the load average otherwise.
722 */
723 static std::array<double, 3> loadAverage() noexcept;
724
725 /**
726 * @brief Store the program arguments.
727 *
728 * Required for getting / setting the process title.
729 *
730 * @return Arguments that haven't been consumed internally.
731 */
732 static char ** setupArgs(int argc, char** argv);
733
734 /**
735 * @brief Gets the title of the current process.
736 * @return The process title.
737 */
738 static std::string processTitle();
739
740 /**
741 * @brief Sets the current process title.
742 * @param title The process title to be set.
743 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
744 */
745 static bool processTitle(std::string title);
746
747 /**
748 * @brief Gets memory information (in bytes).
749 * @return Memory information.
750 */
751 static uint64_t totalMemory() noexcept;
752
753 /**
754 * @brief Gets the amount of memory available to the process (in bytes).
755 *
756 * Gets the amount of memory available to the process based on limits
757 * imposed by the OS. If there is no such constraint, or the constraint is
758 * unknown, `0` is returned.<br/>
759 * Note that it is not unusual for this value to be less than or greater
760 * than `totalMemory`.
761 *
762 * @return Amount of memory available to the process.
763 */
764 static uint64_t constrainedMemory() noexcept;
765
766 /**
767 * @brief Gets the current system uptime.
768 * @return The current system uptime or 0 in case of errors.
769 */
770 static double uptime() noexcept;
771
772 /**
773 * @brief Gets the resource usage measures for the current process.
774 * @return Resource usage measures, zeroes-filled object in case of errors.
775 */
776 static RUsage rusage() noexcept;
777
778 /**
779 * @brief Gets the current high-resolution real time.
780 *
781 * The time is expressed in nanoseconds. It is relative to an arbitrary time
782 * in the past. It is not related to the time of the day and therefore not
783 * subject to clock drift. The primary use is for measuring performance
784 * between interval.
785 *
786 * @return The current high-resolution real time.
787 */
788 static uint64_t hrtime() noexcept;
789
790 /**
791 * @brief Gets the executable path.
792 * @return The executable path, an empty string in case of errors.
793 */
794 static std::string path() noexcept;
795
796 /**
797 * @brief Gets the current working directory.
798 * @return The current working directory, an empty string in case of errors.
799 */
800 static std::string cwd() noexcept;
801
802 /**
803 * @brief Changes the current working directory.
804 * @param dir The working directory to be set.
805 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
806 */
807 static bool chdir(const std::string &dir) noexcept;
808
809 /**
810 * @brief Cross-platform implementation of
811 * [`gettimeofday`](https://linux.die.net/man/2/gettimeofday)
812 * @return The current time.
813 */
814 static TimeVal64 timeOfDay() noexcept;
815
816 /**
817 * @brief Causes the calling thread to sleep for a while.
818 * @param msec Number of milliseconds to sleep.
819 */
820 static void sleep(unsigned int msec) noexcept;
821};
822
823
824/**
825 * @brief Helper type for visitors.
826 * @tparam Func Types of function objects.
827 */
828template<class... Func>
829struct Overloaded: Func... {
830 using Func::operator()...;
831};
832
833
834/**
835 * @brief Deduction guide.
836 * @tparam Func Types of function objects.
837 */
838template<class... Func>
839Overloaded(Func...) -> Overloaded<Func...>;
840
841
842}
843
844
845#ifndef UVW_AS_LIB
846#include "util.cpp"
847#endif
848
849#endif // UVW_UTIL_INCLUDE_H
